dji.sdk.api.Gimbal

Class DJIPhantomGimbal

  • java.lang.Object
    • dji.sdk.api.DJIObject
      • dji.sdk.api.Gimbal.DJIGimbal
        • dji.sdk.api.Gimbal.DJIPhantomGimbal

  • public class DJIPhantomGimbal
extends DJIGimbal

    Dji Phantom Gimbal Class

    DJIPhantomGimbalClass is a specific class for Phantom. Inheriting from the base class, DJIGimbalClass, DJIPhantomGimbalClass could be used to control the Gimbal of Phantom.

    However, please remember that pitch is the only direction that could be changed for phantom 2 and phantom 2 vision.
    Version:
    V2.4.0
    Author:
    DJI Software

    • Method Detail

      • startUpdateTimer

        public boolean startUpdateTimer(int interval)
        Start updating timer and set the interval between each update. This function will set up an updating timer for updating the status of the Gimbal. The timer will periodically request information of gimal's attribute and errors (if it exists). Developer could use setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack and setGimbalErrorCallBack to design the action while the sdk receives the information.
        Please Note that the interval could not be lower than 100;
        Overrides:
        startUpdateTimer in class DJIGimbal
        Parameters:
        interval - The interval between each updating Timer. This will effect the frequency of transporting information from the aircraft. In addition for PV2+ the minimum of the interval is 100ms.
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully starting Update timer.
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        DJIGimbal.startUpdateTimer(int), DJIGimbalAttitude, setGimbalErrorCallBack(DJIGimbalErrorCallBack), setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack(DJIGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack)

      • stopUpdateTimer

        public boolean stopUpdateTimer()
        Stop upating timer.
        Overrides:
        stopUpdateTimer in class DJIGimbal
        Returns:
        boolean true for successfully stopping the updating timer
            false for informing failure.
        See Also:
        DJIGimbal.stopUpdateTimer()

      • setGimbalFpvMode

        public int setGimbalFpvMode(boolean isFpv)
        Set gimbal follow mode.
        Set up first personal vision (FPV). Once you set up this vision, you could get the FPV of the aircraft and the gimbal will not maintain its front-facing angle until you set it back.
        Overrides:
        setGimbalFpvMode in class DJIGimbal
        Parameters:
        isFpv - Set the fpv mode
         true - the module will be set to FPV.
         false - the module will adjust itself.
        Returns:
        int (errorcode)

      • updateGimbalAttitude

        public void updateGimbalAttitude(DJIGimbalRotation pitch,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation roll,
                                 DJIGimbalRotation yaw)
        Update the gimbal angle. Please notice that the parameters are objects of DJIGimbalRotation and please make sure that the parameters (enable, direction, type, angle) are set correctly
        Overrides:
        updateGimbalAttitude in class DJIGimbal
        Parameters:
        pitch - The pitch angle (DJIGimbalRotation object)
        roll - The roll angle (DJIGimbalRotation object)
        yaw - The yaw angle (DJIGimbalROtation object)

      • setGimbalErrorCallBack

        public void setGimbalErrorCallBack(DJIGimbalErrorCallBack mCallBack)
        Set GimbalErrorCallBack
        Overrides:
        setGimbalErrorCallBack in class DJIGimbal
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The gimbal error callBack The gimbal error callBack which will return the type of error by error codes.

        onResult(int error) - the error is the error code for different type of errors.

      • setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack

        public void setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack(DJIGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack mCallBack)
        Set GimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack
        Overrides:
        setGimbalUpdateAttitudeCallBack in class DJIGimbal
        Parameters:
        mCallBack - The gimbal update attitude callBack The gimbal update attitude callBack. This callback will return an object of DJIGimbalAttitude which contains the gimbal's information of pitch, roll and yaw.

        onResult(DJIGimbalAttitude attitude) - attitude is an instance of DJIGimbalAttitude and it contains the value of pitch, roll and yaw.
